info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:47PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cameron and south central Calcasieu Parishes through 315 PM CDT... At 247 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Charles Regional Airport, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Grand Lake, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Heberts Marina and Carlyss. This includes Interstate 210 between mile markers 4 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
